item.title: 美国监管机构敲定太阳能电池板和房屋净值贷款新规
item.description: 美国消费者金融监管机构周二敲定了新的法规，该机构表示，新法规将保护通过房产税为太阳能电池板和其他采购提供资金的房屋装修借款人。【原文：The U.S. watchdog agency for consumer finance on Tuesday finalized new regulations it said would protect home improvement borrowers who finance solar panels and other purchases through their property taxes, the agency said.】

item.title: 星巴克员工工会授权在美国举行潜在罢工
item.description: 代表 10,000 多名星巴克咖啡师的工会表示，他们已授权在本周二与该咖啡巨头进行今年最后一轮谈判之前举行一次可能的罢工。【原文：The workers union representing more than 10,000 Starbucks baristas said they have authorized a potential strike, ahead of this year's final round of bargaining talks with the coffee giant on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜登政府未能实现政府车队电动车目标 - 报告
item.description: 美国政府问责局周二发布的一份报告称，美国政府机构未能实现政府车队电动汽车采购目标。【原文：U.S. government agencies failed to meet government fleet electric vehicle purchase targets, a Government Accountability Office report released Tuesday said.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份商业库存勉强增长
item.description: 由于零售商和批发商库存的小幅增长被制造商库存的下降部分抵消，10 月份美国商业库存略有上升。【原文：U.S. business inventories edged up in October as modest increases in stocks at retailers and wholesalers were partially offset by a decline at manufacturers.】

item.title: 本田的目标是到 2030 年将混合动力汽车销量翻一番，作为通向电动汽车时代的 "桥梁"。
item.description: 日本汽车制造商本田汽车公司（Honda Motor）周三表示，该公司的目标是到2030年将其全球混合动力汽车年销量从2023年的水平翻一番，达到130万辆，为全电动汽车的普及提供 "桥梁"。【原文：Honda Motor aims to double its global hybrid car sales to 1.3 million vehicles annually by 2030 from 2023 levels, providing a "bridge" until fully electric vehicles become more widespread, the Japanese automaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 11 月制造业产出反弹不及预期
item.description: 尽管波音公司（Boeing）工厂工人的瘫痪性罢工已经结束，但由于航空航天业的持续疲软部分抵消了机动车产量的提振作用，11 月份美国制造业生产的反弹幅度低于预期。【原文：U.S. manufacturing production rebounded less than expected in November as the boost from motor vehicle output was partially offset by persistent weakness in the aerospace industry, despite the end of a crippling strike by factory workers at Boeing.】

item.title: Databricks 在以人工智能为重点的新一轮融资中获得 620 亿美元估值
item.description: Databricks 周二表示，该公司在获得由 Thrive Capital 领投的 100 亿美元融资后，估值已达 620 亿美元，这凸显了对以人工智能为重点的初创企业的强劲需求。【原文：Databricks said on Tuesday it had secured a valuation of $62 billion after a $10 billion funding round led by Thrive Capital, highlighting the robust demand for artificial intelligence-focused startups.】

item.title: 欧洲主管表示，Stellantis 意大利工厂将从 2026 年起提高产量
item.description: 斯特兰蒂斯汽车公司欧洲业务主管让-菲利普-伊姆巴拉托（Jean-Philippe Imparato）周二表示，由于新车型的推出，斯特兰蒂斯意大利所有生产基地将继续保持活跃，并将从2026年起增加产量。【原文：All Stellantis Italian production sites will remain active and will increase output from 2026 thanks to new models being introduced, Jean-Philippe Imparato, the chief of the carmaker's European operations, said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 11 月零售销售超出预期
item.description: 美国 11 月份的零售销售增长超过预期，汽车购买量加速增长，这与本年度即将结束时经济的强劲势头相一致。【原文：U.S. retail sales increased in more than expected in November amid an acceleration in motor vehicle purchases, consistent with strong underlying momentum in the economy as the year winds down.】

item.title: 加拿大 11 月通胀率降至 1.9
item.description: 周二的数据显示，受物价广泛放缓的影响，加拿大11月份的年通胀率意外放缓了1个百分点，降至1.9%，消费者物价指数月度环比持平。【原文：Canada's annual inflation rate unexpectedly slowed by a tick to 1.9% in November, driven by a broad-based slowdown in prices, and the consumer price index was unchanged on a monthly basis, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 富士软体拒绝贝恩提高的收购要约，坚持与 KKR 合作
item.description: 日本 IT 公司富士软通（Fuji Soft）周二发表声明称，重申支持美国私募股权公司 KKR 的第二阶段要约收购，并反对竞争对手贝恩资本（Bain Capital）提出的更高报价。【原文：Japanese IT firm Fuji Soft has reaffirmed its support for the second stage of a tender offer buyout from U.S. private equity firm KKR and came out against a higher offer from rival Bain Capital, it said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会禁止在酒店和活动门票价格中暗藏垃圾费
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周二通过了一项规定，要求机票销售商、酒店和度假租赁网站提前披露包括费用在内的总价，禁止他们在最后一刻才隐瞒附加费用。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission passed a rule on Tuesday requiring ticket sellers, hotels and vacation rental sites to disclose total prices, including fees upfront, prohibiting them from concealing add-on charges until the last minute.】

item.title: 加航寄希望于强劲的休闲旅行需求，到 2028 年实现强劲的收入增长
item.description: 加拿大航空公司（Air Canada）周二表示，在国内和国际航线休闲旅游需求强劲的推动下，该公司 2028 年的营业收入将比今年增长 36%。【原文：Air Canada said on Tuesday it was targeting a 36% jump in its 2028 operating revenue from the current year, riding a wave of strong demand for leisure travel across domestic and international routes.】

item.title: 消息称，Stellantis 将在意大利生产新型大众市场机型
item.description: 两位消息人士告诉路透社，Stellantis 将把一款新的大众市场车型分配给其一家意大利工厂，作为本周二向意大利政府提交的长期生产计划的一部分。【原文：Stellantis will assign a new mass market model to one of its Italian plants as part of a long-term production plan due to be presented on Tuesday to the Italian government, two sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储的谨慎态度和通胀风险再次推高美国国债收益率预期
item.description: 路透社的一项调查显示，在美联储剩余降息次数有限和2025年通胀风险上升的预期下，债券策略师对美国国债收益率的预测连续第二个月走高。【原文：U.S. Treasury yield forecasts from bond strategists have marched higher for a second month amid expectations of limited remaining Federal Reserve rate reductions and rising inflation risks in 2025, a Reuters survey found.】

item.title: 辉瑞公司预测 2025 年利润符合预期
item.description: 制药商辉瑞公司周二表示，预计其 2025 年的利润将几乎符合华尔街的预期，因为该公司正试图抵御激进对冲基金 Starboard Value 对其扭亏战略的批评。【原文：Drugmaker Pfizer on Tuesday said it was expecting its 2025 profits to be nearly in line with Wall Street expectations as it seeks to fend off criticism over its turnaround strategy from activist hedge fund Starboard Value.】

item.title: 欧盟就 TikTok 干扰选举一事展开调查
item.description: 欧盟委员会周二对社交媒体公司 TikTok 提起正式诉讼，指控其涉嫌未能限制对选举的干预，特别是在上个月罗马尼亚总统投票中。【原文：The European Commission opened formal proceedings on Tuesday against social media firm TikTok over its suspected failure to limit election interference, notably in the Romanian presidential vote last month.】

item.title: 美联储召开会议，七国集团政局动荡，债券躁动不安
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美联储会议召开前收益率上升，期货走势摇摆不定；零售销售即将公布
item.description: 美国股指期货周二下跌，债券收益率上升增加了压力，因为交易员们在等待零售销售数据，这些数据将在本周晚些时候美联储预计降息之前提供更多有关消费者健康状况的线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Tuesday, with rising bond yields adding pressure as traders braced for retail sales data that will provide more clues on the health of consumers ahead of an anticipated Federal Reserve rate cut later in the week.】

item.title: 2024 年将成为 "债券之年"，资金流入将突破 6000 亿美元大关
item.description: 今年，投资者向全球债券基金投入了创纪录的 6,000 亿美元，在不确定的 2025 年到来之前，利用了数十年来最高的一些收益率。【原文：Investors have poured a record $600 billion into global bond funds this year, taking advantage of some of the highest yields in decades ahead of an uncertain 2025.】

item.title: 特朗普撞车？美联储官员准备对新总统任期进行预测
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上月当选连任以来，包括美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在内的美联储政策制定者都表示，现在将美国当选总统尚未出台的详细政策纳入预测还为时过早。【原文：Since Donald Trump's election to a second term last month, Federal Reserve policymakers including Chair Jerome Powell have said it is too soon to factor in the U.S. president-elect's yet-to-be-detailed policies into forecasts.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言在 ABC 新闻达成和解后提出更多诽谤索赔
item.description: 当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一加强了对新闻机构的法律威胁，并表示他还将考虑以诽谤罪起诉社交媒体影响者和其他人，两天前美国广播公司新闻频道（ABC News）同意与他达成诉讼和解。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump on Monday stepped up his legal threats against news outlets and said he would also consider suing social media influencers and others for defamation, two days after ABC News agreed to settle a lawsuit with him.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国同意向 PG&E 提供 150 亿美元贷款
item.description: 华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国将向总部位于加利福尼亚州的公用事业公司 PG&E 提供创纪录的 150 亿美元低息贷款，用于支持气候适应项目和电网升级。【原文：The United States will offer a record $15 billion low-interest loan to California-based utility PG&E to support climate resilience projects and upgrade the electrical grid, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国银行称，投资者对美国股票的配置创历史新高，对现金的配置创历史新低
item.description: 根据博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）12 月份的一项调查，投资者对美国股票的配置在本月创下了历史新高，牺牲了欧洲股票、大宗商品和现金。【原文：Investor allocations to U.S. equities has hit a record high this month, at the expense of European stocks, commodities and cash, according to a December survey from BofA Global Research.】

item.title: 美国敲定向台湾环球晶圆公司提供 4.06 亿美元芯片补贴
item.description: 美国商务部周二表示，已敲定向台湾环球晶圆公司（GlobalWafers）提供 4.06 亿美元的政府补助金，以大幅提高美国的硅晶圆产量。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday it has finalized $406 million in government grants to Taiwan's GlobalWafers to significantly increase production of silicon wafers in the United States.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔完成 15 亿美元债务转换用于亚马逊河流域保护
item.description: 非政府组织大自然保护协会（The Nature Conservancy）周二表示，厄瓜多尔已经完成了第二次债换自然，这一次将释放 4.6 亿美元用于保护和管理亚马逊雨林的森林和湿地。【原文：Ecuador has completed its second debt-for-nature swap, this time unlocking $460 million to protect and manage the forests and wetlands of its Amazon rainforest, NGO The Nature Conservancy said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 越南全面削减行政开支引发投资者的期待与担忧
item.description: 官员和投资者表示，共产党执政的越南正计划进行数十年来最大胆的官僚改革，裁减部委、机构和广播公司，以减少瓶颈和繁文缛节，但这有可能导致短期 "瘫痪"。【原文：Communist-run Vietnam is planning its boldest bureaucratic reform in decades, slashing ministries, agencies and broadcasters in a bid to reduce bottlenecks and red tape, but risking short-term "paralysis", officials and investors said.】

item.title: 大众汽车与工会就削减成本恢复今年最后一轮谈判
item.description: 在周一进行的一轮长达 13 小时的谈判未能达成协议后，大众汽车管理层和劳工代表将于周二上午继续就该汽车制造商德国工厂的成本削减计划进行高压谈判。【原文：Volkswagen management and labour representatives will resume high pressure talks on Tuesday morning over planned cost cuts to the carmaker's German sites after a 13-hour negotiation round on Monday failed to produce an agreement.】

item.title: 瑞士政府预测明年经济增长 1.5
item.description: 瑞士政府周二预测，明年瑞士经济将增长 1.5%，略微下调了对欧洲传统上最具弹性经济体之一的展望。【原文：The Swiss economy will grow by 1.5% next year, the government forecast on Tuesday, slightly revising down its outlook for one of Europe's traditionally most resilient economies.】

item.title: 2024 年震惊澳大利亚企业界的丑闻
item.description: 澳大利亚 "四大 "银行之一的澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）的股东将于本周就即将离任的首席执行官谢恩-埃利奥特（Shayne Elliott）的薪酬进行投票表决，与此同时，该银行正因被控债券交易不当行为而接受调查。【原文：Australian 'Big-Four' bank ANZ Group's shareholders are set to vote on outgoing chief executive Shayne Elliott's pay this week, while the lender is being investigated for alleged bond-trading misconduct.】
